get_home_ip_remotely Functions¶

get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email Functions¶

Get the dynamic public IP from router at home, encrypt it, and send it to the remote via email automatically.

get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email.get_ip_from_router(router_ip_url, authorization_headers, ip_regex, logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Get the dynamic public IP from router at home.

You should log in the router using browser, and study it to get the three arguments.

Parameters

  • router_ip_url (str) – URL of page that displays public IP realtime.

  • authorization_headers (dict) – request HTTP headers for authorization.

  • ip_regex (str) – regex string for searching public IP.

example:

router_ip_url = 'http://192.168.0.1/userRpm/StatusRpm.htm'
authorization_headers = {
    'Authorization': 'Basic YWRtaW46SklNNDgxNDg2MGppbQ=='}
ip_regex = r'wanPara\s+=\s+new\s+Array\(.*?"(\d+\.\d+\.\d+\.\d+)",'
get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email.send_mail(send_from, send_to, subject, user_name, password, text='', html='', img='', files=[], cc_to=[], server='localhost', port=465, logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Send email with plain text or HTML text.

Parameters

  • send_from (list) – sender email address.

  • send_to (list) – receiver emails address list.

  • subject (str) – title of email.

  • user_name (str) – user name of email account.

  • password (str) – password of email account.

  • text (str) – plain text to send.

  • html (str) – HTML text to send.

  • img (str) – image file path to send.

  • files (list) – files list as attachement.

  • cc_to (list) – cc emails address list.

  • server (str) – email SMTP server IP or domain.

  • port (int) – email SMTP server port.

get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email.encrypt_text(text, encrypt_password, salt, logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Encrypt text with password and salt.

Example:

salt = b'\x66(\x1dkY\x860\xfa\xe8\x82\x1a\xda\x1eG\xf1p'
Parameters

  • text (str) – text to be encrypted.

  • encrypt_password (bytes) – password to generate a key.

  • salt (bytes) – salt key for encrypted text.

get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email.main(logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.get_ip_then_send_via_email (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Get the dynamic public IP from router, encrypt it, then send it via email.

You need config your email account and text tag to identify the specific email.

get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip Functions¶

Pull the public IP from email server, decrypt it and update hosts with it.

get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip.get_mail_text(user_name, password, server, port=993, return_subject=False, logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Get the email which has home IP.

Not only get the email, but also delete the old emails.

Parameters

  • user_name (str) – user name of email account.

  • password (str) – password of email account.

  • server (str) – email IMAP server IP or domain.

  • port (int) – email IMAP server port.

  • return_subject (bool) – return subject or not.

get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip.decrypt_text(encrypted_text, encrypted_password, salt, logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Decrypt text with password and salt.

Example:

salt = b'\x66(\x1dkY\x860\xfa\xe8\x82\x1a\xda\x1eG\xf1p'
Parameters

  • encrypted_password (bytes) – password to generate a key.

  • salt (bytes) – salt key for encrypted text.

get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip.update_hosts(ip, hosts_file='/etc/hosts', logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Update home IP for domains in hosts file.

home_ip.txt

save the new home ip, just one line.

domain.txt

contain the domains for home ip, one domain per line, and can comment one line with #.

Parameters

  • ip (str) – IP to be updated.

  • hosts_file (str) – hosts file path.

get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip.main(hosts_file='/etc/hosts', logger=<Logger get_home_ip_remotely.pull_update_ip (DEBUG)>)[source]¶

Get encrypted text from email server, decrypt it, and update hosts with it.
